result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel L. Nelson-Ashford

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): Bob and Randy's Bar and any of their employees. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Not to be on the premises of any Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Reside in Marathon County until case is resolved. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:24 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett in person for ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Vanessa Avila in person.

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$1,000 Cash Bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Bob and Randy's Bar and any of their employees.
- Not to be on the premises of any Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Reside in Marathon County until case is resolved. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PTC 08/18 @ 8:40 pm

Branch 3 File. 

Adjourned: 2:30 pm
